title: ‚ÄúWe Want You Back‚Äù: Anthony Edwards Sends Heartfelt Message to ‚ÄúOG‚Äù Mike Conley
description: It‚Äôs that time of year in the NBA when goodbyes echo around the league, with teammates forced to bid farewell to some of the most influential figures in the locker room. For Anthony Edwards in 2025, it meant saying goodbye to Mike Conley Jr.
fullText:
It‚Äôs that time of year in the NBA when goodbyes echo around the league, with teammates forced to bid farewell to some of the most influential figures in the locker room. For Anthony Edwards in 2025, it meant saying goodbye to Mike Conley Jr., a veteran who had been instrumental in the Minnesota Timberwolves‚Äô recent rise in the league.

Conley had a rollercoaster 24 hours. He was first traded to the Chicago Bulls, who just one day later, sent him to the Charlotte Hornets. But that may not be the end of this trade-deadline adventure, as there‚Äôs a chance he may have to pack his bags again.

Edwards, after the Timberwolves‚Äô victory over the Toronto Raptors earlier today, admitted to hearing that the organization can try to get him back. As a result, he decided to do his part.

Conley joined the Wolvesin 2023 and quickly became one of the leaders in the locker room as they made two trips to the Conference Finals. In particular, helped Edwards a lot when he was struggling.

‚ÄúMike man, he‚Äôs an OG. Always helped me when I was struggling on court. Great conversations off the court, great dude overall,‚Äù Edwards said.

The trade deadline day can be brutal. Players who have been comfortable in a city for years may be forced to move to the other side of the country and turn their lives upside down in a matter of hours. For Conley, he‚Äôs already traveled from Minneapolis to Chicago and on to Charlotte.

So, due to the Andrew Bogut rule, given that he‚Äôs been traded twice in the span of 24 hours, he can now return to the original team that he left. Seem as though Edwards keeps hoping that he flies right back home.

‚ÄúI keep hearing he can come back, so hopefully he will, and I hope he sees this,‚Äù Edwards said. ‚ÄúWe want you back, Mike. He knows we miss him.‚Äù

The Timberwolves organization would ideally love to bring someone of Conley‚Äôs stature back. He wasn‚Äôt playing much in 25/26, but had an invaluable veteran presence. And if Edwards, arguably the cornerstone of Minnesota, asks the front office to try to make a move for him again, they would at least give it a try.

The post ‚ÄúWe Want You Back‚Äù: Anthony Edwards Sends Heartfelt Message to ‚ÄúOG‚Äù Mike Conley appeared first on The SportsRush.

title: What Are the Best Player Rivalries In the NBA Today?
description: Rivalries are the backbone of the NBA. Rivals Week just passed, but the lineup wasn‚Äôt up to par. Some fan-favorite matchups are missing, such as the Spurs and Thunder, or the historic Celtics and Lakers, built off the backs of Magic Johnson and Larry Bird. Player rivalries build team rivalries. Seeing players go head-to-head to [‚Ä¶] The post What Are the Best Player Rivalries In the NBA Today?
fullText:
Rivalries are the backbone of the NBA. Rivals Week just passed, but the lineup wasn‚Äôt up to par. Some fan-favorite matchups are missing, such as the Spurs and Thunder, or the historic Celtics and Lakers, built off the backs of Magic Johnson and Larry Bird.

Player rivalries build team rivalries. Seeing players go head-to-head to prove who‚Äôs the best is what makes the NBA the most entertaining.

With that being said, here are the four best player rivalries currently taking place in the NBA:

Anytime Lebron faces off with Steph Curry or Kevin Durant, it‚Äôs still a marquee matchup. LeBron, Durant, and Curry are a callback to an era now passed. Every time the NBA begins a new season, fans know they are that much closer to these show-stopping battles are coming to an end.

That means every game is a must-watch. When any combination of these three go head-to-head, it‚Äôs apparent how badly they each want to come out victorious over the other.

From Finals matchups to random regular-season contests, each of the three give their all when they step on the court against each other.

A different side of LeBron comes out when he faces Dillon Brooks. We‚Äôve never seen a player get under the King‚Äôs skin like the Phoenix Suns guard. This rivalry has been filled with trash talk, physical confrontations, and heated moments.

Brooks is averaging a career high of 21.1 points per game and elevates his play every time he goes up against the Lakers. Los Angeles‚Äô last matchup with the Suns ended in a blowout.

It seems like Brooks has made it his personal mission to mess with the Hall of Famer, and fans are eagerly awaiting their next duel.

Chet Holmgren going up against Victor Wembanyama has been one of the NBA‚Äôs most compelling feuds as of late.

Since Wembanyama entered the NBA, he and Chet have had a budding rivalry. The two towering figures first faced off in the 2021 FIBA World Cup, where Holmgren and Team USA walked out with the win.

The Spurs seem to have the Thunder‚Äôs number this year, as they‚Äôve beaten them three times this season. It feels like Wembanyama circles every Thunder game on his calendar.

Wembanyama is on a mission to prove he‚Äôs far and away the best young center in the NBA. The Spurs‚Äô phenom is a generational talent, but Holmgren has something he doesn‚Äôt: a championship ring.

Edwards Vs. SGA is a heavyweight fight with the title for best guard in the NBA on the line. The intensity always reaches a fever pitch when these two play each other. The two players mirror each other in many ways. Both became leaders of their team at a relatively young age and became stars around the same time.

Ant and SGA have taken subtle shots at each other through shoe commercials. It‚Äôs clear they both have immense respect for each other, but are fighting to be the best. The Timberwolves have won two out of three matchups with the Thunder this season, but these two will be battling it out for years to come.

Attention player haters and disbelievers of all kinds‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/5tzoBwvUZ4

‚Äî adidas Basketball (@adidasHoops) October 24, 2025

The post What Are the Best Player Rivalries In the NBA Today? appeared first on The Lead.

title: Sophie Cunningham reacts to Reggie Miller's player comp for Caitlin Clark
description: Who would Caitlin Clark's NBA player comp be? The one Reggie Miller chose may have come from left field.
fullText:
Reggie Miller was effusive in his praise for Caitlin Clark on Sunday night "Basketball Night in America" during a pregame conversation on NBC.

The Indiana Pacers legend said he would relinquish his unofficial "best shooter in Indiana" title to the Indiana Fever star and Tyrese Haliburton of the Pacers.

Miller then offered an NBA player comp for Clark that caught a lot of people off guard: Payton Pritchard of the Boston Celtics. Both are prolific outside shooters and strong ball handlers, but Clark is a focal point for the WNBA, while Pritchard is a complementary player.

title: LeBron James reveals late WWE legend inspired his ‚ÄòJoker‚Äô villain role with Miami Heat
description: LeBron James has offered a fascinating insight into how a legendary WWE heel turn helped shape one of the most controversial chapters of his NBA career. After all, the Los Angeles Lakers star explained that his time with the Miami Heat was influenced by an unlikely wrestling icon.
fullText:
LeBron James has offered a fascinating insight into how a legendary WWE heel turn helped shape one of the most controversial chapters of his NBA career.

After all, the Los Angeles Lakers star explained that his time with the Miami Heat was influenced by an unlikely wrestling icon.

James‚Äô decision to embrace the villain role after leaving Cleveland in 2010 transformed how fans viewed him, and he has since acknowledged that the reaction was not only anticipated but studied.

Speaking on a recent episode of the Mind the Game podcast, LeBron revealed that the late WWE legend Hulk Hogan played a key role in how he understood fame, backlash, and reinvention.

‚ÄúI grew up watching Hulk Hogan. At one point, Hulk Hogan was like America, as everyone loved him. What it means to be an American.

Then one day, he went to N.W.O. and people couldn‚Äôt understand how he tagged up with the enemy,‚Äù James said.

He added: ‚ÄúThey were like, ‚ÄòWhat is going on?‚Äô Everybody just booed him. He went from wearing red and yellow to black and white.‚Äù

Hogan‚Äôs infamous switch from beloved hero to villain in the 1990s stunned wrestling fans and redefined his career.

LeBron saw clear parallels when he joined forces with Dwyane Wade and Chris Bosh in Miami, a move that instantly made him the league‚Äôs most polarising figure.

LeBron explained that accepting the villain label was partly about understanding entertainment as much as competition.

‚ÄúOne, we‚Äôre entertainers as well‚Ä¶ Listen, we want to go out and have fun, smile and be happy because that‚Äôs what brings us joy,‚Äù James continued.

He concluded, stating: ‚ÄúBut we can tap into the Joker role if y‚Äôall make us, now. We can get there too now, and still be able to perform at a high level.‚Äù

During his Miami Heat years, James leaned into the boos, the black uniforms, and the perception that he was basketball‚Äôs ultimate antagonist.

Rather than fighting public sentiment, he channelled it. The result was one of the most dominant stretches of his career, with championships, MVPs, and a sharpened edge that defined a new version of LeBron.

Much like Hogan‚Äôs transformation elevated professional wrestling, LeBron‚Äôs embrace of the villain role reshaped the NBA‚Äôs modern era. It was controversial, deliberate, and ultimately successful.

title: NBA: First-time All-Stars for 2025-2026 season
description: The 2025‚Äì26 NBA season delivered a fresh wave of breakout stars, with six players earning their first All-Star selections through sustained growth and undeniable impact. Each of these players took a meaningful leap, either by expanding their offensive responsibilities, anchoring‚Ä¶
fullText:
The 2025‚Äì26 NBA season delivered a fresh wave of breakout stars, with six players earning their first All-Star selections through sustained growth and undeniable impact. Each of these players took a meaningful leap, either by expanding their offensive responsibilities, anchoring a defense, or becoming indispensable to their team‚Äôs identity. Together, they represent the league‚Äôs constant evolution and the reward that comes from opportunity meeting preparation.

Deni Avdija breaks new ground as one of the league‚Äôs most complete two-way forwards this season. His All-Star nod reflects a career-high scoring uptick and unprecedented playmaking for a Trail Blazers forward, putting him among the rare players averaging 25+ points, 7+ rebounds, and 6+ assists. Beyond the counting stats, Avdija‚Äôs selection is historic: he‚Äôs the first NBA All-Star from Israel, showcasing his rapid ascent and growing global impact. His versatile game has been a key factor for Portland‚Äôs competitiveness this season.

Jalen Duren has emerged as a true interior force for the Detroit Pistons, anchoring both ends of the court with energy and efficiency. This first All-Star selection comes as a result of his elite rebounding and inside scoring, where he ranks among the league‚Äôs best in key paint-dominant metrics. Duren‚Äôs physicality sets the tone for Detroit defensively, and his offensive improvements have made him a reliable secondary scoring option. His trajectory suggests he could become one of the NBA‚Äôs premier big men for years to come.

Chet Holmgren‚Äôs All-Star breakthrough signifies the Thunder‚Äôs rise defensively and his unique impact on both ends of the floor. In just his third NBA season, he‚Äôs developed into a disruptive rim protector while continuing to expand his scoring and rebounding prowess. Holmgren‚Äôs combination of size, agility, and shooting range makes him a matchup problem and a centerpiece of OKC‚Äôs identity. His inclusion among the league‚Äôs elite this year highlights how integral he‚Äôs become to his team‚Äôs success

Back at full health after a season cut short by injury, Jalen Johnson has taken a massive leap to become one of the Hawks‚Äô central playmakers. His All-Star selection reflects career-high production across scoring, rebounding, and facilitating, with a rare all-around stat line that puts him in elite company. Johnson‚Äôs athleticism and versatility have given Atlanta a multi-dimensional threat on offense and a disruptive presence on defense. This first All-Star appearance underscores his growth into a franchise cornerstone.

Jamal Murray‚Äôs first All-Star nod comes after years of high-impact performances that previously went unrecognized in the midseason showcase. This season represents a personal best on both ends of the court, where he‚Äôs set new marks in scoring, assists, and shooting efficiency. Murray‚Äôs knack for clutch play and generating offense has been vital for the Nuggets, especially during stretches without Nikola Jokiƒá. His breakthrough honors reflect the high-level consistency he‚Äôs brought to Denver‚Äôs lineup.

At 32 years old, Norman Powell‚Äôs first All-Star selection is a testament to perseverance and gradual refinement of his game. In Miami, Powell has become a primary scoring threat, putting up career-best numbers while leading one of the highest-scoring offenses in the league. His sharpshooting and ability to take over games in isolation have made him an X-factor for the Heat. This long-awaited recognition rewards years of hard-earned development and situational excellence.

These first-time All-Stars didn‚Äôt arrive by accident; their selections reflect seasons defined by consistency, resilience, and expanded roles. From young cornerstones announcing their arrival to veterans finally receiving overdue recognition, this group captures multiple paths to All-Star status. As the league continues to shift, the 2025‚Äì26 class stands as a snapshot of the NBA‚Äôs next phase and the players shaping it.

title: Kawhi Leonard named to NBA All-Star Game as late add: What to know
description: Kawhi Leonard has been picked to the NBA All-Star Game by commissioner Adam Silver as a late addition, the league announced Tuesday.
fullText:
The Intuit Dome will have an All-Star playing on his home floor, after all.

Los Angeles Clippers star Kawhi Leonard has been named to the NBA All-Star Game by commissioner Adam Silver, the league announced Tuesday afternoon. Leonard was originally left off the roster after he wasn't voted in by the fans, media or players as a starter or coaches as a reserve, but the teams were a player short under the new format.

This year's All-Star Game will be "USA vs. the World." Three teams -- two teams of American players and one team of international players -- will compete against each other in a round robin-style tournament on Sunday, Feb. 15. Leonard's addition brings the total number of U.S. All-Stars to 16, the minimum required.

There was some backlash online after Leonard, who's averaging a career-high 27.6 points per game, 6.1 rebounds, 3.6 assists and a league-leading 2.06 steals in 36 games played this season.¬† He's also been as efficient as he's ever been, shooting 49.7%, 39.1% from three-point range and has the fourth-best free throw percentage in the league at 91.3%.

This will be Leonard's seventh career All-Star selection.

Per the NBA's statement, the All-Star teams will be revealed at 4 p.m. PT Tuesday night on Peacock during the pregame show ahead of the Boston Celtics-Dallas Mavericks game.

This article originally appeared on USA TODAY: Los Angeles Clippers star Kawhi Leonard selected for NBA All-Star Game

title: Clippers‚Äô Kawhi Leonard Added to NBA West All-Star Roster
description: Los Angeles Clippers superstar Kawhi Leonard was considered to be one of the most shocking omission from the 2026 NBA West All-Star roster this season. When the reserve players for both conferences were announced on Sunday, the list did not‚Ä¶
fullText:
Los Angeles Clippers superstar Kawhi Leonard was considered to be one of the most shocking omission from the 2026 NBA West All-Star roster this season. When the reserve players for both conferences were announced on Sunday, the list did not include Leonard.

But on Tuesday, Leonard was added to the Western Conference‚Äôs roster, according to NBA insider Shams Charania. Leonard is the 16th U.S. All-Star, which is the minimum requirement. The initial group of 24 All-Stars had only 15 U.S. All-Stars.

Los Angeles Clippers star Kawhi Leonard has been selected to the 2026 NBA All-Star Game. After the selection of the initial 24 All-Stars, Leonard was added to bring the total number of U.S. All-Stars to 16, the minimum required.

‚Äî Shams Charania (@ShamsCharania) February 3, 2026

Leonard will be a reserve player for the Western Conference alongside the following seven players:

Los Angeles Lakers forward LeBron James

Minnesota Timberwolves guard Anthony Edwards

Denver Nuggets guard Jamal Murray

Oklahoma City Thunder center Chet Holmgren

Houston Rockets forward Kevin Durant

Phoenix Suns guard Devin Booker

Portland Trail Blazers forward Deni Avdija

The West Conference starters will be Los Angeles Lakers forward-guard Luka Doncic, Oklahoma City Thunder guard Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, San Antonio Spurs forward Victor Wembanyama, Denver Nuggets center Nikola Jokiƒá and Golden State Warriors guard Stephen Curry.

This is Leonard‚Äôs seventh NBA All-Star selection of his career. He is the only Clippers player to have earned an All-Star selection this season.

The Western Conference is filled with superstars, but Leonard has been one of the top players in the NBA since defeating the Los Angeles Lakers on Dec. 20. He has led the Clippers out of a 6-21 rut and now the team is 23-26.

Although many believed Leonard should have been named an All-Star initially, the two-time NBA champion told reporters he was not expecting to earn the honor after the Clippers‚Äô game against the Philadelphia 76ers on Monday.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs never an expectation for me. I was a guy that had to work my way into those conversations. It is what it is. I‚Äôm gonna enjoy my time,‚Äù Leonard said, per Joey Linn on X.

Kawhi Leonard last night on his All-Star snub:

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs never an expectation for me. I was a guy that had to work my way into those conversations. It is what it is. I‚Äôm gonna enjoy my time.‚Äù

Would he have liked to be chosen:

‚ÄúYeah, of course. Every player does‚Ä¶ but they all‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/V68w1ZbC08

‚Äî Joey Linn (@joeylinn_) February 3, 2026

Now, Leonard is a 2026 All-Star and will have the opportunity to represent the Clippers in the All-Star Game that is taking place at the Intuit Dome.

title: ‚ÄôHoos in the NBA: Ty Jerome makes his return
description: The former UVA star picked up right where he left off last season.
fullText:
The former UVA star picked up right where he left off last season.

After missing the first 46 games of the season due to a lingering calf strain, former Virginia Cavaliers star Ty Jerome is finally back in action and already winning over a new fanbase.

It was a disappointing start to the season for Jerome, who broke out last year with the Cleveland Cavaliers to the tune of 19.9 points and 7.0 assists per game, leading to a third-place finish in the NBA‚Äôs Sixth Man of the Year Voting.

Jerome‚Äôs impressive campaign earned him a three-year, $27 million deal with the Memphis Grizzlies in July, but his Grind City debut was pushed back until the final day of January for the first of a pair of home games against the Minnesota Timberwolves.

The 2019 National Champion has quickly made up for lost time, scoring a team-high 20 points in Saturday‚Äôs 131-114 loss before following it up with a 19-point, 8-assist, 6-rebound performance on Monday night in a 137-128 rematch win over the T-Wolves.

Despite playing just 20 minutes in each of his first two appearances for Memphis due to a minutes restriction, Jerome is already bringing stability to a Grizzlies backcourt that has dealt with injuries and inconsistency throughout the season. Jerome is shooting 54.5% from the field while showing off his trademark deliberate pace and elite decision-making as Memphis‚Äôs floor general.

‚Äú[Jerome] doesn‚Äôt look like the most explosive guy, but he gets to his spots on the floor because he reads so well the body language of not only his own defender but also the helping defenders,‚Äù said Grizzlies head coach Tuomas Iisalo to the media after Monday night‚Äôs win. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs actually so good that he can manipulate [defenders] to get out of the space that he wants to create or get into the space that he wants to create for someone else.‚Äù

With Jerome sidelined and several other key players (including 2x All-Star Ja Morant, who has missed 28 games this season) in and out of the lineup, the Grizzlies went just 18-28 in their first 46 games, leaving them currently three games out of the play-in equation in the Western Conference.

In other pro ‚ÄôHoos news, De‚ÄôAndre Hunter made headlines over the weekend as he was dealt from the Cavaliers to the Sacramento Kings in exchange for Dennis Schroder and Keon Ellis ahead of February 5th‚Äôs NBA trade deadline.

It hasn‚Äôt been the season that many envisioned for Hunter, who averaged 14.0 points in 43 games this season with Cleveland on 42.3% shooting from the floor and a career-low 30.8% from beyond the arc. But a new home might be exactly what is needed for the 2019 fourth-overall pick. The Kings, which have a league-worst 12 wins this season, are in full-on tank mode, meaning we won‚Äôt be seeing Hunter back in the postseason this spring. However, Sacramento could be a perfect spot for the former ‚ÄôHoo to become an offensive focal point and once again show the league what he‚Äôs capable of in the right environment.

title: 4 James Harden landing spots as NBA trade rumors explode
description: Seems like the Los Angeles Clippers could trade James Harden. Here are some potential landing spots before the NBA trade deadline.
fullText:
James Harden has continued to be a huge help to the Los Angeles Clippers after the team's awful start, but he's sat out the past couple of games. Now? There's word via ESPN's Shams Charania that the Clips and Harden are "working through whether the sides can find a deal by Thursday's trade deadline."

Even at age 36, Harden is still averaging 25.4 ppg, 8.1 apg and 4.8 rpg. His contract situation? He's got a partially guaranteed contract this year and a player option for 2026-27. So that could be a factor for whomever acquires him.

So where could he go? Here's a list of some possible destinations as the 2026 NBA trade deadline approaches:

This is the team that's most linked to him, with Darius Garland heading to the Clippers. Why would the Cavs trade a much younger point guard? Well, maybe they think they have a shot at the Eastern Conference this season and perhaps they don't think Garland could be worth the money he could earn soon.

They need a point guard and someone to take some heat off Anthony Edwards. This is a move that would help a lot given their issues at point guard with an aging Mike Conley.

This feels like a darkhorse. The Raps have a lot of young talent, but what if they deal someone (RJ Barrett, perhaps?) for Harden and win a playoff series with him? I honestly don't know if the Raptors feel like they need to interrupt the growth they have as a young roster, but on paper, it might make sense.

I saw the most tweets about this one. Harden gets back with Kevin Durant, returns to the team where he broke out as an MVP. Maybe he's happy being back in Houston? If the Rockets want to keep pace in the super-competitive West, this would be the move.

This article originally appeared on For The Win: James Harden landing spots with NBA trade rumors swirling

title: ‚ÄúNothing About James Harden Spells Champion‚Äù: Emmanuel Acho Goes Off Following Clippers-Cavaliers Trade Story
description: With the NBA trade deadline approaching on Thursday, teams across the league are scrambling to assemble rosters they believe best position them for the future. The Los Angeles Clippers, for their part, are reportedly engaged in serious talks to send James Harden to the Cleveland Cavaliers.
fullText:
With the NBA trade deadline approaching on Thursday, teams across the league are scrambling to assemble rosters they believe best position them for the future. The Los Angeles Clippers, for their part, are reportedly engaged in serious talks to send James Harden to the Cleveland Cavaliers.

This does not appear to be a situation where the Clippers were actively looking to move Harden. He has missed the team‚Äôs last two games for personal reasons, and it has long been understood that he carries significant influence over any potential trade destination. In short, Hardenwants a move away from LA.

Reports suggest the Cavaliers are willing to send Darius Garland to Inglewood in return, a move that would shift them down a path of youth. However, not everyone is convinced it makes sense for Cleveland, with Emmanuel Acho emerging as one of the more vocal critics of the potential deal.

The Clippers, after languishing at the bottom of the West for the first few weeks of the 25/26 season, are creeping up the standings and are currently 9th with a 23-26 record. The Cavs, meanwhile, are 5th in the East and looking to rediscover the form that helped them finish #1 in their conference last season. Acho warned them on Speakeasy that signing Harden won‚Äôt help them achieve that.

‚ÄúI would not want James Harden if I were a championship-caliber team,‚Äù the former NFL player turned sports pundit declared. ‚ÄúNothing about James Harden spells Championship. Nothing about James Harden‚Äôs career spells Championship. He is all the way over the hill, and James Harden has never been a catalyst for winning championships.‚Äù

These may seem like harsh comments, but Acho has a point. He noted how Harden has never helped a team get close to winning a championship, and the only time a team looked deadly with him in the roster was when he was a 6th man in Oklahoma. He failed to deliver success in Houston (ran into prime Warriors to be fair), Brooklyn, Philadelphia, and finally, Los Angeles.

‚ÄúWhen he‚Äôs ever had to be that guy, he‚Äôs not that,‚Äù Acho added. ‚ÄúSo, why in the world would anybody want to trade for James Harden if they actually have championship aspirations?‚Äù

Well, it looks like Harden has championship aspirations for starters. There‚Äôs a reason he‚Äôs switched teams so many times in the 2020s. It‚Äôs not working out anywhere, but he refuses to give up. He‚Äôs averaging 25.4 points per game and assisting 8.1. His playmaking has also significantly improved over the years.

Will teaming up with Donovan Mitchell and Evan Mobley finally give him the fairytale ending he‚Äôs hoping for? We‚Äôll have to wait and see.

title: NBA results: February 2, 2026 ‚Äì winners and losers
description: Monday night in the NBA delivered drama in different ways. One team erased a huge deficit. Another leaned on a single star to survive without key players. Long losing streaks ended, and winning streaks came to a stop. Every game‚Ä¶
fullText:
Monday night in the NBA delivered drama in different ways. One team erased a huge deficit. Another leaned on a single star to survive without key players. Long losing streaks ended, and winning streaks came to a stop. Every game shifted the mood in the standings and showed which teams are finding answers and which ones are still searching.

Charlotte earned its seventh straight win after erasing a 22-point deficit. LaMelo Ball showed toughness after a head collision with coach Charles Lee caused an eye cut. He returned quickly and finished with 24 points. Kon Knueppel scored 17 and hit four three-pointers. Brandon Miller and Grant Williams added 16 each. The Hornets survived 17 turnovers and poor three-point shooting in the first half. Ball‚Äôs drive and dunk in the fourth gave Charlotte the lead. Miller later stole the ball from Herbert Jones and finished with a one-handed dunk. The win pulled Charlotte within a half-game of Atlanta for the final play-in spot.

New Orleans could not hold a strong first-half lead. Trey Murphy III led with 27 points. Zion Williamson had 14 points and 11 rebounds. Derik Queen added 16. Ball‚Äôs injury did not slow Charlotte enough. Defensive pressure hurt the Pelicans late. The loss marked their sixth defeat in nine games. New Orleans struggled to stop dribble drives in the fourth quarter.

Houston won despite missing Kevin Durant and Steven Adams. Alperen Sengun carried the load with 39 points and 16 rebounds. Jabari Smith Jr. added 19. Sengun made 13 of 25 shots and 13 of 18 free throws. Eight of those free throws came in the fourth quarter. The Rockets used a late 12-2 run to seal the game. A replay decision wiped out a possible Pacers buzzer-beater before halftime and shifted momentum. Houston earned its third straight win and third straight road victory.

Indiana could not finish strong after a comeback push. Pascal Siakam scored 27 points. Bennedict Mathurin added 25. The Pacers briefly led in the third quarter after a fast-break pass from Jarace Walker to Siakam. Sengun‚Äôs free throws ended their hopes. The team missed a chance to extend its winning streak to three games. Defensive fouls in the final minutes proved costly.

Memphis snapped a six-game losing streak with sharp shooting. Jaren Jackson Jr. scored 30 points. Ty Jerome had 19. Jaylen Wells added 18. Cam Spencer and Vince Williams Jr. scored 16 each. Three-point shooting changed the game after a poor effort two nights earlier. Memphis went 8 of 15 from deep in the first half. A 20-point lead formed in the second half. Early fourth-quarter threes pushed the margin to 20 again. The Grizzlies stayed ahead even when Minnesota tried to rally.

Minnesota could not repeat its strong showing from Saturday. Anthony Edwards led with 39 points and seven rebounds. Jaden McDaniels scored 29. Donte DiVincenzo had 21, including 13 in the fourth quarter. The Timberwolves never got closer than nine points late. Their four-game winning streak came to an end. Defensive breakdowns on the perimeter hurt them early.

Philadelphia stayed hot with a fourth straight win. Tyrese Maxey scored 29 and hit seven three-pointers. Dominick Barlow posted 26 points and 16 rebounds. Joel Embiid added 24 as he worked back from injury. The Sixers led from start to finish and built a 23-point cushion. A 72-53 halftime lead set the tone. The team improved to 11-10 without Paul George. Balanced scoring and steady defense kept control all night.

Los Angeles missed James Harden for a second straight game. Kawhi Leonard led with 29 points. Jordan Miller added 21 off the bench. Short runs in the fourth quarter failed to change the outcome. Leonard finished on the bench as the gap stayed wide. The Clippers remain in the play-in chase but could not match Philadelphia‚Äôs energy.

February 2 produced wins that mattered beyond the final score. Charlotte proved it can fight back under pressure. Houston showed it can win even when short-handed. Memphis finally broke through after weeks of frustration. Philadelphia kept its steady climb going. For the losing teams, the night exposed problems with closing games and protecting leads. With the season moving fast, these results could shape who stays alive in the NBA playoff race and who falls behind.

The post NBA results: February 2, 2026 ‚Äì winners and losers appeared first on The Big Lead.

title: NBA trade deadline tracker: Latest news, rumors for Giannis Antetokounmpo and more in 2026
description: The Sporting News is tracking all the latest NBA trade news and rumors before Thursday's 3 p.m. ET deadline. Here's the full list of completed deals and more from all 30 teams from this year's deadline.
fullText:
NBA trade deadline tracker: Latest news, rumors for Giannis Antetokounmpo and more in 2026 originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

List of NBA trades completes at deadline

NBA trade deadline deals by team

When is the NBA trade deadline in 2026?

The NBA trade deadline is undoubtedly among the most engaging moments within the entire sports calendar.

The¬†Thursday 3 p.m. ET cutoff for trade agreements is expected to spur considerable activity as it approaches.

Teams are required to finalize their rosters by this deadline before the final phase of the regular season. This year's deadline is particularly intense, with numerous high-profile players rumored to be on the trading block.

As the activity intensifies, The Sporting News will monitor rumors, news, and reported transactions leading up to the deadline. Due to the nature of these deals, some may be announced following the deadline.

Continue to follow this coverage to remain informed of all developments.

Fischer adds that the two sides seem resigned to a separation after eight years together, although that is more likely to come in the offseason when James hits free agency.

"The most aggressive team in the West right now is the Minnesota Timberwolves," said Brian Windhorst. "They are in the game for Giannis, and the Timberwolves are being aggressive. If they don't make what I would call a Hail Mary Giannis deal, I think they are aggressively looking to upgrade their backcourt."

Shams Charania also appeared on ESPN and shared the same reports that Minnesota is indeed one of the most aggressive teams in the¬†NBA when it comes to acquiring¬†Antetokounmpo.

Jackson reported that the Miami Heat are expected to offer an extensive trade package for Antetokounmpo. The offer is anticipated to be Tyler Herro, Kel'el Ware, Terry Rozier, young players, 2 1st-round picks and 3 pick swaps, per Jackson. If the Bucks do happen to acquire Rozier, they will have to pay his entire 25-26 salary.

A day after The Athletic reported that the Knicks are inquiring about Antetokounmpo, ESPN's Brian Windhorst said on "Get Up" Monday morning that, "The Knicks believe in this team.. They believed in this team last summer when Giannis was loosely available in those discussions. They didn't make an aggressive offer at the time of those talks. If they want to win a bidding war now, i think its going to take a 3 or 4 team trade.... That is just not happening. They are not showing that aggression to get Giannis right now and I think thats because they like this team."

While other teams have been mentioned far more often, the Trail Blazers are among the franchises interested in Bucks star Giannis Antetokounmpo, The Oregonian reports. The report adds that new owner Tom Dundon is ready and willing to take big swings to win, which makes Portland a wild card in the Antetokounmpo sweepstakes even if a deal might cost All-Star Deni Avdija.

The Kings still have salary cap concerns despite an abysmal 12-39 record, and ESPN reports that has prompted Sacramento explore trades involving Zach LaVine, Domantas Sabonis, DeMar DeRozan, and Malik Monk. The Kings acquired De‚ÄôAndre Hunter from the Cavaliers on Saturday.

The Knicks are one of the teams inquiring about Bucks star Giannis Antetokounmpo, The Athletic reports, but the Knicks‚Äô inability to fully match what Milwaukee is demanding ‚Äî premier young players and high draft picks ‚Äî is a hurdle.

Knicks big man Karl-Anthony Towns is still a trade candidate despite New York‚Äôs recent resurgence, The Athletic reports. Towns hasn‚Äôt been extended and reportedly has had some hard feelings ever since his name surfaced in Giannis Antetokounmpo trade talks in the offseason.

The Knicks have ‚Äúlong been trying to find a new home‚Äù for forward Guerschon Yabusele, who has struggled since signing in the offseason. Yabusele could need draft assets attached to him to be dealt, The Athletic reports.

The Atlanta Hawks are trading guard Vit Krejci to the Portland Trail Blazers in exchange for Duop Reath and two future second-round selections. The move gives the Hawks the ability to free up roster space, and Atlanta now possesses seven upcoming second-round picks.

The Cleveland Cavaliers are trading De'Andre Hunter to the Sacramento Kings in exchange for Dennis Schroder and Keon Ellis. This transaction involves three teams: the Chicago Bulls acquire Kings forward Dario Saric¬†and two future second-round draft picks. Additionally, the Bulls are waiving guard Jevon Carter to make room for Saric, according to sources. They also acted as a third team and acquired assets to complete the trade.

The Atlanta Hawks are trading four-time NBA All-Star Trae Young to the Washington Wizards in exchange for CJ McCollum and Corey Kispert. The Hawks kick off the trade deadline season with a bang.

CJ McCollum (G) - traded from Wizards

The 2026 NBA trade deadline is at 3 p.m. ET on Thursday, Feb. 5.

It is important to note that the deadline is 3 p.m. ET and whatever corresponding time that is for teams in other time zones. All trades must be agreed upon and submitted to the NBA office by 3 p.m. ET.

title: Social media reacts to Nets' Michael Porter Jr.'s All-Star Game snub

Brooklyn Nets forward Michael Porter Jr. was thought at one point in time to be one of the players that was going to make the All-Star Game for the first time in his career given the season that he's had to this point. In anticipation of Porter being Brooklyn's first All-Star since the 2021-22 season (Kevin Durant), there were plenty of questions asked of the organization regarding the honor, until it was revealed that Porter would not be named an All-Star after all.

On Sunday, around the same time that the Nets tipped off for what ended up being their 130-77 loss at the Detroit Pistons, it was reported by various insiders that Porter did not make the 2026 Eastern Conference All-Star team as a reserve. While there seemed to be virtual locks to make the team as a reserve, such as Cleveland Cavaliers guard Donovan Mitchell and Atlanta Hawks forward Jalen Johnson, Porter was considered by many to be among that group due to his impact on Brooklyn this season.

The reserves for the East are Mitchell, Johnson,¬†New York Knicks¬†center Karl-Anthony Towns,¬†Indiana Pacers¬†forward Pascal Siakam,¬†Miami Heat¬†guard Norman Powell,¬†Toronto Raptors¬†forward Scottie Barnes, and¬†Detroit Pistons¬†center Jalen Duren. Those seven players will join the five starters in¬†Philadelphia 76ers¬†guard Tyrese Maxey, Knicks guard Jalen Brunson, Pistons guard Cade Cunningham, Boston Celtics forward Jaylen Brown, and¬†Milwaukee Bucks¬†forward Giannis Antetokounmpo.

title: James a surprise selection for NBA All-Star game
description: LeBron James is selected for a record-extending 22nd consecutive NBA All-Star game as he is named in the Western Conference reserves.
fullText:
LeBron James has been selected for a record-extending 22nd consecutive NBA All-Star game by being named among the reserves from the Western Conference.

The 41-year-old Los Angeles Lakers star was not selected as a starter in January but was among the seven reserves chosen from each of the Eastern and Western Conferences by NBA coaches.

James, who missed his side's first 14 matches of the 2025-26 campaign because of sciatica, has played 31 times this season and is averaging 21.9 points per game.

"It wasn't a goal of mine to come into the season, miss the first 14 games and say, 'OK, I can be an All-Star'," James told reporters after playing in the Lakers' 112-100 defeat against the New York Knicks.

"I just wanted to get back to playing the game at a high level I knew I was capable of once I kind of worked the rust off of missing pre-season, training camp and my summer workouts, which I've never done in my whole career.

"So I didn't think about the All-Star Game, to be honest."

James was selected for the NBA All-Star game in 2025 but did not play because he picked up an injury.

Kevin Durant, who plays for the Houston Rockets, Devin Booker of the Phoenix Suns and Anthony Edwards from the Minnesota Timberwolves were also selected as a Western Conference reserves.

title: Charles Barkley Jokingly Calls for Nuggets HC to Be Fired After ‚ÄúHolding‚Äù Nikola Jokic Back vs. Clippers
description: After missing around a month of NBA action, Nikola Jokic returned to the court on January 30th against the Los Angeles Clippers, and he looked a hundred percent like his old self. The only problem was that he didn‚Äôt play as long as he normally would, and that irked Charles Barkley.
fullText:
After missing around a month of NBA action, Nikola Jokic returned to the court on January 30th against the Los Angeles Clippers, and he looked a hundred percent like his old self. The only problem was that he didn‚Äôt play as long as he normally would, and that irked Charles Barkley.

The Nuggets won 122-109 against the Clippers, and Jokic scored 31 points and grabbed 12 rebounds. It was business as usual for the Joker, whose return will only bolster the Denver Nuggets‚Äô post-season hopes. The crowd and pundits seemed to miss seeing Jokic‚Äôs greatness on display, which is why Barkleybizarrely called for David Adelman‚Äôs head for limiting the Serbian‚Äôs minutes.

Jokic‚Äòs incredible stat line was a result of just 25 minutes of basketball action. Barkley feels ‚Äî and rightly so ‚Äî that he could have done a lot more. The punishment for Adelman? Fire him.

‚ÄúI gotta call out coach Adelman,‚Äù Barkley said on ESPN. ‚ÄúHe gave this guy 25 minutes; he would have had 40‚Ä¶ We gotta get rid of coach Adelman. He holding this dude back.‚Äù

‚ÄúThis dude should have had 40-15-7‚Ä¶ He can‚Äôt even get his triple-double on cuz he played half the game,‚Äù the Round Mound of Rebounds added.

Of course, he was joking. No coach would be fired simply for restricting their star player‚Äôs minutes, especially after returning from a long-term injury. Jokic missed 16 games with a knee injury he suffered on December 29. Now, he is back and will slowly, but surely, play more minutes to satisfy Barkley and others.

The Nuggets looked fine without Jokic as well, which makes them an even scarier team. They went 10-6 in his absence, establishing themselves as a genuine contender in the Western Conference.

Unfortunately, Jokic‚Äôs second game back was not as impressive. He scored just 16 points, grabbed seven rebounds, and recorded eight assists in a 121‚Äì111 loss to the Oklahoma City Thunder, the top team in the NBA. He played four more minutes than he did against the Clippers, which once again shows that Adelmandoes not want to risk losing his best player to injury again this season.

The post Charles Barkley Jokingly Calls for Nuggets HC to Be Fired After ‚ÄúHolding‚Äù Nikola Jokic Back vs. Clippers appeared first on The SportsRush.

title: Celtics‚Äô Joe Mazzulla Reveals Plan For NBA Trade Deadline
description: The NBA Trade Deadline is coming up on Feb. 5, and players are already starting to change teams. The Boston Celtics are in an interesting position this year. While they were expected to be deadline sellers coming into the season, they‚Äôve wildly surpassed expectations, going 31-18 and ranking second in net rating. Accordingly, the Celtics [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
The NBA Trade Deadline is coming up on Feb. 5, and players are already starting to change teams.

The Boston Celtics are in an interesting position this year. While they were expected to be deadline sellers coming into the season, they‚Äôve wildly surpassed expectations, going 31-18 and ranking second in net rating.

Accordingly, the Celtics are more likely to be buyers than sellers this week given their place in the standings. However, they could still look to offload a player or two to clear up some payroll and open a spot for Jayson Tatum‚Äôs expected return.

Given the rumors and uncertainty, the trade deadline is always a stressful and anxious time for players, coaches and executives alike. Anything can happen.

Prior to Sunday‚Äôs game against the Milwaukee Bucks, Joe Mazzulla revealed how he‚Äôs handling it this year.

Joe Mazzulla emphasizes adhering to routine when asked about handling the days leading up to the trade deadline:

‚ÄúYou just stick to the process every day.‚Äù pic.twitter.com/Kav4aJiviC

‚Äî Bobby Krivitsky (@BobbyKrivitsky) February 1, 2026

‚ÄúYou just stick to the process every day, what gives you a chance to win that particular day,‚Äù Mazzulla said during his pregame press conference. ‚ÄúMaximize the day. Is it a game day? Is it an off day? Is it a day where we gotta come in and watch film? Is it a day that we gotta practice? You just have to understand what day you‚Äôre at and make sure you put your focus on that.‚Äù

That type of focus should serve Mazzulla and his players well over the next few days. After destroying the Bucks on Sunday, they‚Äôre off on Monday before traveling to Texas for a back-to-back against the Dallas Mavericks and Houston Rockets. Then they‚Äôre off on Thursday, the day of the deadline.

Mazzulla doesn‚Äôt get distracted easily, so look for him to stay locked in and keep his team prepared over the next few days as they look to get off to a strong start in February.

title: Mavericks rookie Cooper Flagg unlocks an unmatched NBA feat
description: Cooper Flagg makes NBA history as first teenager with consecutive 30-point double-doubles, scoring 49 and 34 points for Mavericks in back-to-back games.
fullText:
Mavericks rookie Cooper Flagg unlocks an unmatched NBA feat originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Cooper Flagg has rewritten NBA history. The 19-year-old Dallas Mavericks rookie became the first teenager ever to record consecutive games with 30 points and 10 rebounds on January 29 and February 1, 2026.

The No. 1 overall pick from Duke University achieved this milestone despite both losses for the Mavericks. This accomplishment surpasses all previous teenage records in NBA history.

On January 29, 2026, Flagg set a new NBA record for points scored by a teenager in a single game, erupting for 49 points in a 123-121 loss to the Charlotte Hornets.

Flagg was exceptionally efficient, shooting 20-of-29 (69%) from the field and a perfect 6-of-6 from the free-throw line. This performance surpassed the previous teenage scoring record of 45 points set by Cliff Robinson in 1980.

Earlier in the season, on December 15, 2025, Flagg had already broken LeBron James' specific record for an 18-year-old by scoring 42 points against the Utah Jazz. James' record was 37 points and it was set in 2003.

Two days after his record-breaking 49-point game, Flagg continued his historic rookie run on January 31, 2026, recording 34 points and 12 rebounds in a 111-107 loss to the Houston Rockets.

Playing 39 minutes, the 6-foot-9 forward shot 52% (13-of-25) and became the first teenager in NBA history to achieve consecutive 30-point double-doubles.

Flagg scored 30 points for the fifth time this season, including 22 points in the first quarter alongside Brandon Williams, helping Dallas stay competitive after an early deficit.

The teenager scored a total of 83 points in two games, an unprecedented achievement for any player under 20. Flagg now ranks third among teenagers with 40-plus points, alongside Kevin Durant and LeBron James.

title: NBA All-Star Game format, explained: What to know about 2026 USA vs. World rules, draft, rosters and more
description: The Sporting News has you covered with everything you need to know about the notable changes to this year's All-Star Game format.
fullText:
NBA All-Star Game format, explained: What to know about 2026 USA vs. World rules, draft, rosters and more originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The NBA All-Star game is changing once again.

The league has tinkered with different formats throughout the past few years, trying to inject excitement into a game that has lost its luster. Their latest change is the most dramatic. This year's game will feature a theme of America versus the World. The hope is that it adding an element of national pride will lead to more competitive play.

NOH: My projected All-Star reserves for 2026

This year's game will feature a round robin tournament between two American teams and one World team. Each team will consist of at least eight players. Participants from both the Eastern and Western conference will be mixed among all three teams.

In the event that the 24 All-Stars are not divided evenly between 16 Americans and eight international players, commissioner Adam Silver will select players to the game until each team can field at least eight players. That may result in some teams that have more players than others.

There will be four games in total played, with each game lasting 12 minutes.¬†In the round-robin tournament, Team A will play Team B in Game 1. ¬†The winning team from Game 1 will take on Team C in Game 2, followed by the losing team of Game 1 meeting Team C in Game 3.

After Game 3, the top two teams by record will advance to face each other in the championship game (Game 4). ¬†If all three teams have a 1-1 record after Game 3, the tiebreaker would be point differential in each team‚Äôs two round-robin games.

MORE:¬†The 11 worst contracts in the NBA, based on my salary tool

The reserves will be announced on Sunday, Feb. 1.

The starters, who will be divided up among the three teams (two American, one World), have been announced and are as follows:

All-Star Weekend will take place from Friday, Feb. 13 to Sunday, Feb. 15. The event will be hosted at Intuit Dome in Inglewood, California, home of the Clippers. The schedule is as follows:

title: Suns‚Äô Dillon Brooks doesn‚Äôt hold back on Lakers‚Äô LeBron James during live stream
description: PHOENIX ‚Äî Phoenix Suns guard Dillon Brooks has never shied away from honesty, and on Saturday, he was candid when asked who he believed was the most overrated player in the NBA. Dec 23, 2025; Phoenix, Arizona, USA; Los Angeles Lakers forward LeBron James (23) moves the ball against Phoenix Suns forward Dillon Brooks in the first half at Mortgage Matchup Center.
fullText:
PHOENIX ‚Äî Phoenix Suns guard Dillon Brooks has never shied away from honesty, and on Saturday, he was candid when asked who he believed was the most overrated player in the NBA.

Dec 23, 2025; Phoenix, Arizona, USA; Los Angeles Lakers forward LeBron James (23) moves the ball against Phoenix Suns forward Dillon Brooks in the first half at Mortgage Matchup Center. Mandatory Credit: Mark J. Rebilas-Imagn Images

Brooks was a guest on Twitch streamer N3on‚Äôs broadcast, as the duo drove around Phoenix and Brooks showed the streamer the Suns‚Äô locker room and practice facility. At one point, N3on posed the question to Brooks, who answered without hesitation.

‚ÄúI would probably say Lebron [James] right now,‚Äù the Suns guard said. ‚ÄúI feel like he overrated right now, his time is coming to an end.‚Äù

Needless to say, the remark quickly went viral online. Within hours, Brooks‚Äô honesty was met with a flurry of reactions from fans.

The comment marks another chapter in the rivalry Brooks and James have found themselves in this season. Both players have had their fair share of exchanges during games between the Suns and the Los Angeles Lakers.

The most notable came in a Dec. 14 thriller, when the two spent much of the night jawing at each other before Brooks was ultimately ejected in the closing seconds after receiving his second technical foul following a confrontation with James after hitting a go-ahead 3-pointer.

Phoenix would eventually fall to Los Angeles, 116-114.

Dec 1, 2025; Los Angeles, California, USA; Los Angeles Lakers forward LeBron James (23) moves the ball against Phoenix Suns forward Dillon Brooks (3) during the first half at Crypto.com Arena. Mandatory Credit: Gary A. Vasquez-Imagn Images

As a defining figure in the league for more than two decades, James has been one of the most accomplished players in NBA history. However, Brooks‚Äô comments suggest he views James strictly as an on-court rival, regardless of his accolades.

The moment also reinforces Brooks‚Äô reputation as an unapologetic edge-setter for the Suns. His confrontational persona has resonated with the fan base and, while it has occasionally led to foul trouble, it has also helped fuel Phoenix to much-needed wins and momentum.

Dec 14, 2025; Phoenix, Arizona, USA; Phoenix Suns forward Dillon Brooks (3) and Los Angeles Lakers forward LeBron James (23) react during an altercation that resulted in a technical for Brooks during the second half of a game at the Mortgage Matchup Center. Mandatory Credit: Allan Henry-Imagn Images

Whether the remark draws a response from James or lingers into future matchups between the Western Conference rivals, Brooks continues to find himself at the center of the NBA‚Äôs national conversation.

title: Celtics' Payton Pritchard leads NBA in impressive stat
description: The Boston Celtics' No. 3 scoring option is having a noteworthy season.
fullText:
Celtics' Payton Pritchard leads NBA in impressive stat originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Payton Pritchard is among the most underrated No. 3 scoring options in the league.

The 6-foot-1 Boston Celtics guard has done nothing but improve his game since entering the league in 2020, and with Jayson Tatum sidelined with an Achilles injury, he‚Äôs received a more significant offensive role with the 2024 NBA champions.

According to the X/Twitter account 'Real App, ' Payton currently leads the NBA in an impressive stat.

‚ÄúPayton Pritchard has the most games in the NBA this season with 25+ points & zero free throws attempted,‚Äù the notable statistics-based account stated.

Why is that stat so admirable? Well, it‚Äôs common for players to erupt for 25+ points while attempting multiple free throws. In some cases, it‚Äôs so extreme that fans will throw out terms like ‚Äòfoul baiter‚Äô and ‚Äòfree throw merchant‚Äô to help diminish a player‚Äôs performance.

When an individual doesn‚Äôt get any whistles in a 25-point outing, it means they had no choice but to fight through contact and score at a high clip. Pritchard has done just that this season, helping the Celtics navigate life without Tatum.

Pritchard is averaging 17.0 points, 5.3 assists, and 4.3 rebounds per game this year, shooting 45.9% from the field and 35.3% from downtown. The Celtics will need Pritchard to remain consistent if they want to return to the NBA Finals.

title: The 3 trades the Cleveland Cavaliers are being tied to currently
description: The Cleveland Cavaliers may be about to make some minor, but necessary moves at the NBA Trade Deadline.
fullText:
The 3 trades the Cleveland Cavaliers are being tied to currently originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Still, moves are expected to happen. Two of the biggest names that could be out the door by next Thursday include, but aren't limited to, Lonzo Ball and DeAndre Hunter. Right now, both men have seemingly worn out their welcome in Cleveland, and in order for the Cavs to get under the second apron comfortably, both men would likely have to be moved.

Luckily for the Cavs, GM Mike Gansey has done a good job of building out some young players to make moves like this possible. The rise of Jaylon Tyson, the development of Craig Porter, and the unexpected boost that rookie Tyrese Proctor have given the Cavs this season have made Hunter and Ball expendable. Which is good, because neither man is going to fetch you that much back in a trade.

Ideally, the Cavs trading Hunter and Ball away for nothing, or maybe a second-round pick in a future draft, would be ideal. That would get the Cavs under the second apron and allow them to make more moves in the future. Plus, the team has enough talent on its roster right now to try to contend without additional players coming back. These moves would also help the Cavs land LeBron James in the near future, assuming he wants to return to Cleveland to finish out his career.

So the trade rumors persist, and three of them have gotten the most traction, so let's look at them.

The Los Angeles Lakers acquire F DeAndre Hunter
The Cleveland Cavaliers acquire¬†F¬†Rui Hachimura and F Dalton Knecht

According to Cleveland.com's Chris Fedor, this is a trade that's been talked about but doesn't seem to have much legs at the moment. The goal here is Knecht. Keeping Hachimura would be nice; he's a solid big man who can play a variety of positions, but his contract isn't appealing, and he doesn't offer much more than anyone on the Cavs roster currently. Sending Hachimura to a team like the Brooklyn Nets would be nice, as you as they can eat his salary, but that seems unlikely at the moment. Knecht makes it possible for the Cavs to move on from Max Strus in the offseason, saving the team even more money. That is, assuming Knecht can show some potential with the Cavs this season.

The Sacramento Kings acquire F DeAndre Hunter¬†
The Cleveland Cavaliers acquire G Keon Ellis, G¬† Dennis Schroder, and Dario Saric.

The prior trade with the Lakers seems like a salary dump waiting to happen; this Kings trade seems like the opposite. While HoopsHype's Michael Scotto seems to believe that Ellis is the goal for the Cavs, they would be wise to consider keeping Schroder as well. The guard is everything the Cavs were hoping Lonzo Ball would be. He's a decent scorer still, and while not a stud by any means, he'd be a fine enough addition to the Cavs as a backup for Darius Garland. He's in the first year of a three-year deal that'll pay him between $14 and $15 million a year, so he may not be the guy you want to keep around past this season, but he could fill a need in the wake of the failure of Ball's trade if you don't trust Porter or Proctor yet.

The Washington Wizards get G Lonzo Ball
The Cleveland Cavaliers get TBD

It may not seem like much of a trade, but as reports have pointed out, Lonzo Ball is 460th in shooting percentage out of 450 eligible players. He's washed, and the thought of giving up Isaac Okoro for him in a trade makes some fans a little ill to this day. The Washington Wizards know that the Cavs wanna dump Ball's salary so that the Cavs have wiggle room for the trade deadline. So they're offering to take Ball off the Cavs ' hands, for a nominal fee. They want draft capital in return, according to HoopsHype Scotto. A fair offer, but it seems unlikely the Cavs would give up a first-round pick to get rid of Ball, so this could be a situation where Ball and two second-round picks head over to the Wizards for a second-round pick of their own. It's a bold move, but one that would get the Cavs closer to being under the second apron.

title: Philadelphia's Paul George gets 25-game NBA drugs ban
description: Paul George, a nine-time NBA All-Star forward for the Philadelphia 76ers, was issued a 25-game suspension by the league on Saturday for violating the NBA Anti-Drug Program.The 35-year-old American who has averaged 20.5 points over his 16-year NBA career, said in a statement to ESPN he mistakenly took a mental health medication that violated the NBA and players union joint anti-drug policy.
fullText:
Paul George, a nine-time NBA All-Star forward for the Philadelphia 76ers, was issued a 25-game suspension by the league on Saturday for violating the NBA Anti-Drug Program.

George's ban will begin with Saturday's Sixers home game against New Orleans.

The 35-year-old American who has averaged 20.5 points over his 16-year NBA career, said in a statement to ESPN he mistakenly took a mental health medication that violated the NBA and players union joint anti-drug policy.

"Over the past few years, I've discussed the importance of mental health, and in the course of recently seeking treatment for an issue of my own, I made the mistake of taking an improper medication," George told ESPN.

"I take full responsibility for my actions and apologize to the Sixers organization, my teammates and the Philly fans for my poor decision making during this process.

"I'm focused on using this time to make sure that my mind and body are in the best condition to help the team when I return."

George would not be eligible to return until the 76ers play host to Chicago on March 25, with only 10 games remaining in the regular season for the Sixers.

George has averaged 16.0 points, 5.1 rebounds, 3.7 assists and 1.5 steals over 27 games this season for Philadelphia, which stands 26-21 and sixth in the Eastern Conference.

Together with Joel Embiid and Tyrese Maxey, the 76ers were expected to be contenders this season but their time together as a triple threat has been limited by injuries.

The ban is expected to cost George about $11.7 million of his season salary and save the 76ers about $5 million in luxury tax payments under the league's salary cap system.

Taken by Indiana with the 10th pick in the 2010 NBA Draft, George played seven seasons for the Pacers, earning the 2013 NBA Most Improved Player award.

George, who captured Olympic gold with the US team of NBA stars at Rio in 2016, was traded to Oklahoma City in 2017 and led the NBA with 2.2 steals a game in the 2018-19 campaign.

In 2019, George was sent to the Los Angeles Clippers in a blockbuster deal that brought reigning NBA Most Valuable Player Shai Gilgeous-Alexander to the Thunder along with five first-round draft picks and Italy's Danilo Gallinari -- a swap that helped the Clippers land free agent Kawhi Leonard.

George spent five seasons with the Clippers before opting out of his contract in 2024 and signing a four-year deal worth $212 million with the 76ers.

Injuries limited George to only 41 appearances last season.

title: Rising Stars set to help kick off NBA All-Star Weekend at Intuit Dome
description: Former Clipper Quentin Richardson discusses the format change, what to expect during All-Star Weekend and how much the annual events mean to him and other players.
fullText:
The NBA All-Star Game is returning to the Southland in two weeks and a part of the annual weekend event that has grown in popularity in recent years is the Rising Stars Challenge, which affords fans the opportunity to watch the league‚Äôs top rookies and second-year players compete in a four-team tournament.

Rosters for the mini-tournament to take place on Friday, Feb. 13, at Intuit Dome were drafted this week by a trio of Hall of Famers in Carmelo Anthony, Tracy McGrady and Vince Carter, who will join former NBA player and current NBC/Peacock analyst Austin Rivers as the four honorary coaches (Rivers will coach the G League squad).

Anthony had the No. 1 pick and drafted Dallas rookie forward Cooper Flagg. McGrady went next and chose Charlotte rookie guard/forward Kon Knueppel while Carter opted for Philadelphia rookie guard VJ Edgecombe at No. 3. (Rosters attached at bottom of story.)

Quentin Richardson, drafted by the Clippers with the 18th pick of the 2000 NBA draft, knows all three Hall of Famers well. He was Anthony‚Äôs teammate on the New York Knicks in 2012-13 and faced cousins McGrady and Carter many times throughout their respective careers. Richardson, now 45, enjoys All-Star Weekend and is delighted to see the festivities back in the city where his NBA journey started. A highlight of his 13-year career was making his last nine shots to win the three-point contest in 2005.

‚ÄúI participated in the Saturday night rookie-sophomore game my first couple of years in the league and I just love the event,‚Äù said Richardson, who played for the Clippers from 2000 to 2004 when they were co-tenants with the Lakers at what was then called Staples Center, now Crypto.com Arena. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a platform for the fans to look at the real future stars of the league, the up-and-comers, and with the international boom there‚Äôs so many different young international guys they may not know well from different teams that are out on display that weekend.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs one of those weekends you always want to go to, you always want to be a part of."

The Rookie Challenge was established in 1994 and featured two randomly selected teams of first-year players. The name was changed to Rising Stars Challenge in 2012 and the current tournament-style format was adopted four years ago. Since 2023, the format has been 28 players ‚Äî 21 rookies and sophomores and seven G League players.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm intrigued by the format,‚Äù Richardson said. ‚ÄúWhen I played it was just the rookies and sophomores, two teams, but the kids have gotten behind this so the NBA has been very good about pivoting into different things to try to gain more excitement around the games for that weekend. I‚Äôm all for it.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt‚Äôll be awesome [at Intuit Dome],‚Äù said Richardson, who lives in Orlando and co-hosts the "Knuckleheads" podcast with Darius Miles. ‚ÄúThe young fellas will be put on display for the world to see and that venue is going to be put on display for everyone to see as well. I believe it‚Äôs the newest arena we have in the NBA. So much technology went into it, so it‚Äôll be a great stage for everyone to come and witness and enjoy that.‚Äù

Richardson, Miles and Keyon Dooling starred in the 2004 documentary "The Youngest Guns" about their first three seasons with the Clippers. Richardson hosts NBA HooperVision in addition to the pregame, halftime and postgame shows for the Magic.

‚ÄúThe rules have changed in a way that you‚Äôre allowing the fans to watch more scoring,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThe pace has been sped up, the three-point shot is a bigger deal now, they shoot it with a higher volume. From a fan‚Äôs standpoint you want to see more scoring and more defense, but the defenders now have that much more skill because they don‚Äôt have as many rules in their favor.‚Äù

In the Rising Stars mini-tournament, Team A will face Team B in the first semifinal and Team C will play Team D in the second semifinal. The two winners will meet for the championship. For each semifinal, the first team to reach or surpass 40 points is the winner. For the final, the first team to reach or surpass 25 points will be the champion.

‚ÄúI like how they draft for it,‚Äù Richardson said. ‚ÄúIt picks from the essence of how we all grew up when you played in the park or rec league, wherever you went, one guy had two dudes to choose and you get to pick your five, so it‚Äôs kind of taking you back to the essence of how we grew up playing ball. It‚Äôs something we‚Äôre all familiar with so that‚Äôs a little twist that takes us back to our roots.‚Äù

In November, the NBA announced that the All-Star Game will adopt a new USA vs. the World format: a round-robin tournament featuring two teams of American players and another of international players, each consisting of at least eight players. The top two teams based on record will advance to the finals. All four games will be played with a 12-minute time limit.

‚ÄúAbsolutely, it‚Äôll continue to be a global sport,‚Äù Richardson said. ‚ÄúEspecially with them talking about NBA Europe, that‚Äôll make everything bigger and better. They‚Äôve got the Africa League so from commissioner David Stern to now Adam Silver they‚Äôve done an incredible job of growing the brand. Proof is in the amount of international guys we have in the league now. It‚Äôs known far and wide and it‚Äôll continue to get bigger and bigger.‚Äù

Richardson thinks the success of the All-Star Game is dependent on the best players participating.

‚ÄúIt just takes a couple of guys ‚Ä¶ one or two of the right guys to come out and participate,‚Äù he said. "When a couple guys do it, I think you‚Äôll see the turn. The three-point contest, the dunk contest, it‚Äôll take one big-name guy to go out and do it and everyone else will say, ‚ÄòOh wait, he‚Äôs doing it? I need to do it.‚Äô It‚Äôll get back there. It‚Äôs a great weekend for the NBA ‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs like a family reunion. I just go out there and enjoy it.‚Äù

title: Philadelphia 76ers' George given 25-game drug ban
description: Philadelphia 76ers forward Paul George is suspended without pay for 25 games  for violating the NBA's anti-drug programme.
fullText:
Philadelphia 76ers forward Paul George has been given a 25-game suspension for violating the NBA's anti-drug programme, the league has announced.

The nine-time NBA All-Star, who has averaged 20.5 points over his 16-year NBA career, said he mistakenly took an "improper" medication.

George, 35, said in a statement to ESPN: "Over the past few years, I've discussed the importance of mental health, and in the course of recently seeking treatment for an issue of my own, I made the mistake of taking an improper medication.

"I take full responsibility for my actions and apologise to the Sixers organization, my team-mates and the Philly fans for my poor decision making during this process.

"I'm focused on using this time to make sure that my mind and body are in the best condition to help the team when I return."

The NBA said George would be suspended without pay for the duration of his ban. He is not eligible to return until the 76ers play the Chicago Bulls on 25 March - when there will be only 10 games of the regular season remaining.

title: Egor D√´min has his best NBA game in win over Jazz, reflects on his time at BYU
description: Former BYU Cougar Egor D√´min set an NBA record in his return to Utah during Friday night‚Äôs game between the Jazz and the Brooklyn Nets, as he became the first NBA rookie to hit a 3-pointer in 34 consecutive games.  Despite shooting only 27.3% from 3 his freshman year at BYU, he‚Äôs made it his biggest asset as an NBA player.
fullText:
Former BYU Cougar Egor D√´min set an NBA record in his return to Utah during Friday night‚Äôs game between the Jazz and the Brooklyn Nets, as he became the first NBA rookie to hit a 3-pointer in 34 consecutive games.

Despite shooting only 27.3% from 3 his freshman year at BYU, he‚Äôs made it his biggest asset as an NBA player. He‚Äôs jumped up to 39.7% shooting from distance, and hit his 100th career 3-pointer against the Jazz Friday.

In the first quarter of Friday‚Äôs game, he shot 3 of 5 from deep and then kept it going, finishing with a career high 25 points and 10 rebounds for his first career double-double.

He finished with six 3-pointers Friday night, shooting 6 of 12.

He said there‚Äôs been no magical fix for his shot outside of just consistent work.

‚ÄúShooting the ball, pretty much as simple as it is,‚Äù D√´min said. ‚ÄúJust being in the gym and shooting the ball.‚Äù

Egor D—ëmin for üëå

He now has a 3PM in 34 consecutive games, the longest streak for ANY ROOKIE in NBA history! pic.twitter.com/tSeJUwOQGL

D√´min caught up with the media ahead of Friday night‚Äôs game, and he spoke about his experience in the NBA, playing at BYU and what it‚Äôs meant to him to return to Utah.

‚ÄúIt feels awesome. Super excited to be back here,‚Äú D√´min said. ‚ÄúObviously, expecting a lot of BYU colors tonight. Just super grateful to be back here.‚Äù

He also said he had roughly 30 people show up for him for Friday‚Äôs game. Many of them were from his BYU circles.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a lot of (the) culture about BYU,‚Äù D√´min said. ‚ÄúA lot of people know how united the BYU organization is in general. Not just basketball, or just football, or whatever it is, but the whole sports together.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve been lucky enough to end up in that school and gain so many friends and so many people around me who want the best for me and who I want (the) best for, so it‚Äôs just super exciting to be a part of that big BYU family.‚Äù

D√´min also spoke highly of BYU head coach Kevin Young. When Young was hired by the Cougars, the main selling point was that he could turn BYU into a place where players could come to develop an NBA-level game.

D√´min was the first of the Young era to make good on that claim, and he‚Äôs done so with encouraging numbers. He‚Äôs started in 34 games this year for the Nets and will be a participant in the NBA‚Äôs Rising Stars game.

Reppin‚Äô Brooklyn in this year‚Äôs NBA Rising Stars Game: EGOR D√ãMIN üåü pic.twitter.com/pNOvCM95NJ

‚Äî Brooklyn Nets (@BrooklynNets) January 26, 2026

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs an NBA coach, so he taught me in this one year basically whatever I have to know to be able to play in the NBA level,‚Äù D√´min said of Young. ‚ÄúMaybe not even as much of a skill set-wise, because at the end of the day, you get to the league and you just be yourself. That‚Äôs kind of the goal.

‚ÄúHe taught a lot of knowledge, (like) that I come here and I‚Äôm ready to play, and I know what we‚Äôre doing, and I have an idea of what it is. He gave me this kind of base of an NBA player, to be able to come here and know what‚Äôs going on around me.‚Äù

title: NBA schedule for January 31: Matchups and predicted winners
description: Saturday‚Äôs NBA slate packs in six games with playoff energy and clear betting angles. From Charlotte‚Äôs hot streak against San Antonio to Houston hosting an injury-hit Dallas side, every matchup has a story behind it. Some teams rely on rebounding,‚Ä¶
fullText:
Saturday‚Äôs NBA slate packs in six games with playoff energy and clear betting angles. From Charlotte‚Äôs hot streak against San Antonio to Houston hosting an injury-hit Dallas side, every matchup has a story behind it. Some teams rely on rebounding, others on star scorers, and a few are just trying to survive tough stretches. Here is a closer look at who holds the edge and why these games matter. (Odds via CBS Sports)

Date: Saturday, January 31, 2026

Venue: Spectrum Center, Charlotte

Charlotte enters this game riding a five-game winning streak. The Hornets have been strong on the glass, ranking near the top of the East in rebounding at 45.7 per game. Moussa Diabate leads them with 8.4 rebounds. San Antonio also rebounds well at 46.3 per game, with Luke Kornet setting the pace.

Victor Wembanyama continues to anchor the Spurs with 24.3 points and 11.2 rebounds per game. Miles Bridges leads Charlotte at 18.5 points, while Brandon Miller has averaged 23.4 points over the last 10 games.

Recent form favors Charlotte slightly. Over the last 10 games, the Hornets average 116.5 points and allow only 107.4. San Antonio has scored 110.7 in the same span. Home momentum and the +4.5 line make Charlotte the safer side.

Predicted winner: Charlotte Hornets

Date: Saturday, January 31, 2026

Venue: Gainbridge Fieldhouse, Indianapolis

Indiana struggles in blowout games and owns an 8-24 record in the East. Still, the Pacers play closer games at home. Andrew Nembhard averages 17.4 points and 7.4 assists, while Pascal Siakam has scored 20.8 per game over the last 10.

Atlanta is 12-17 against conference teams and recently beat Indiana 132-116. Onyeka Okongwu leads the Hawks with 16.3 points and 7.9 rebounds. Nickeil Alexander-Walker has added 19.7 points per game over the last 10.

The Pacers shoot only 44.3 percent this season, but Atlanta allows 47.5 percent to opponents. With a short spread and home court edge, Indiana has a narrow path to control the pace.

Predicted winner: Indiana Pacers

Date: Saturday, January 31, 2026

Venue: Xfinity Mobile Arena, Philadelphia

New Orleans comes in at 12-37 and allows 121.2 points per game. Defense has been the main issue. The Pelicans still rebound well at 44 per game and force nearly 15 turnovers. Zion Williamson remains their focal point, averaging 21 points in the last outing with 11 rebounds.

Philadelphia is 25-21 and just beat Milwaukee 139-122. Paul George scored 32 in that win. The 76ers average 116.6 points but sit near the bottom of the league in shooting efficiency at 45.8 percent.

The Pelicans allow 48.3 percent shooting, which keeps games close late. A large spread gives New Orleans room to stay competitive even if they do not lead for long stretches.

Predicted winner: New Orleans Pelicans

Date: Saturday, January 31, 2026

Minnesota holds a 29-19 record and ranks fifth in scoring at 119 points per game. Julius Randle just dropped 31 points in a win over Dallas. The Timberwolves shoot 48.1 percent and allow only 114.1 points.

Memphis sits at 18-27 and struggles offensively at 45.4 percent shooting. Jaren Jackson Jr. scored 26 in the last game, but team rebounding remains an issue. The Grizzlies were outworked on the boards by Charlotte in their last loss.

The Timberwolves force turnovers and defend the three well at 35.2 percent allowed. With better balance on both ends, Minnesota should control the matchup.

Predicted winner: Minnesota Timberwolves

Date: Saturday, January 31, 2026

Chicago enters after three straight losses but still averages 118.7 points over the last 10 games. Nikola Vucevic posts 17 points and 9.1 rebounds, while Coby White leads fast-break scoring.

Miami has gone 6-4 in its last 10 and scores 121.3 points per game in that span. Bam Adebayo averages 18 points and shoots 44.5 percent. The Heat won the last meeting 116-113.

The Bulls shoot 47.6 percent this season, slightly higher than what Miami allows. With a +5.5 line, Chicago can stay within range even if Miami controls the fourth quarter.

Predicted winner: Chicago Bulls

Date: Saturday, January 31, 2026

Dallas is 19-29 and missing key players like Kyrie Irving and Anthony Davis. Cooper Flagg has been productive, but the Mavericks give up 116.7 points per game.

Houston stands at 29-17 and thrives when limiting turnovers. Kevin Durant averages 26.5 points, while Alperen Sengun adds steady scoring inside. The Rockets allow only 110 points per game, which ranks among the league‚Äôs best marks.

Dallas won the last meeting, but the injury list has grown. Houston‚Äôs defense and depth give them a strong edge at home.

Predicted winner: Houston Rockets

These six games shape a busy Saturday card. Charlotte and Indiana look strong at home. Minnesota and Houston hold the clearest advantages. New Orleans and Chicago bring value due to large spreads. Each matchup carries a different style of play, which should make January 31 a full night of competitive basketball.
